title: Poster, "Exhibition Poster: Lawrence Weiner, Twenty Works, Anthony d'Offay Gallery, London", 1980
title_raw: Exhibition Poster: Lawrence Weiner, Twenty Works, Anthony d'Offay Gallery, London
inscribed:
Imprinted at top: "LAWRENCE WEINER TWENTY WORKS".  Imprinted in black, left side: "AN OBJECT TOSSED FROM ONE COUNTRY TO ANOTHER/ A TURBULENCE INDUCED WITHIN A BODY OF WATER/ TO THE SEA/ DONE WITHOUT/ AS IF IT COULD/ MADE QUIETLY/ TAKEN TO A POINT OF TOLERANCE/ WITH RELATION TO REASON (OFTEN) MOVED ABOUT/ SOME THINGS (PACKED UP)SOME THINGS (LAID DOWN)ALL OVERDUE/ BLOWN AWAY/UNDER CERTAIN CIRCUMSTANCES"
Imprinted in black, right side: "THE ARTIC CIRCLE SHATTERED/ FOLDED/ SLOWLY RAISED WATER/ OVER THE HILL/ TO SHOW AND TO TELL/ [TURNED] RED AS WELL AS BLACK/ OFTEN REPLAYED (PLAYED AGAIN)/ (OFTEN) MOVED ABOUT WITHIN THE CONTEXT OF [A] REASON/ HAVING BEEN BOUGHT BACK AT A POINT OF PASSAGE/ MANY OBJECTS PUT UPON MANY OTHER OBJECTS IN PLACE OF SOME OTHER OBJECTS NO LONGERUSED TO FORM A PILE".
Imprinted at bottom: "ANTHONY d'OFFAY 23 DERING STREET NEW BOND STREET LONDON W1/ 22 OCTOBER - 19 NOVEMBER 1980 PRIVATE VIEW TUES 21 OCTOBER 5-7"
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment and Smithsonian Institution Collections Acquisition Program Funds
description: Art exhibition poster comprised of text arranged into table (with two columns, each with ten rows).  The table lists twenty phrases which constitute the works in the exhibition (see inscription).   At top and bottom of sheet are rectangular boxes for text with exhibition title (top); gallery name, address, exhibition dates (bottom).

tombstone.epitaph: Poster, "Exhibition Poster: Lawrence Weiner, Twenty Works, Anthony d'Offay Gallery, London", 1980. Offset lithograph on white paper. Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment and Smithsonian Institution Collections Acquisition Program Funds. 1999-45-32.
